Cause: Communication error between the printer control board (PRCB) and the PF drive board (PFDB), PFU drive board (PFUDB) or the LU drive board (LUDB).
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • PF drive board (PFDB) • PFU drive board (PFUDB) • LU drive board (LUDB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - Be careful not to confuse the LUDB of LU-202m with the LUDB of LU-202XLm.
Solution: 1. Deactivate the sub power switch and the main power switch, and then unplug the power plug. Then Restart the main body after 10 seconds. 2. PF-602m: Check the connector connection between PRCB and PFDB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. PF-707m: Check the connector connection between PRCB and PFUDB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. LU-202m: Check the connector connection between PRCB and LUDB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. LU-202XLm: Check the connector connection between PRCB and LUDB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Replace PRCB. 4. PF-602m: Replace PFDB. PF-707m: Replace PFUDB. LU-202m: Replace LUDB. LU-202XLm: Replace LUDB.

Cause: Communication error between the printer control board (PRCB) and the conveyance drive board (CDB).
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • Conveyance drive board (CDB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Deactivate the sub power switch and the main power switch, and then unplug the power plug. Then Restart the main body after 10 seconds. 2. Check the connector connection between PRCB and CDB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Replace PRCB. 4. Replace CDB.

Classification: Main body: Paper feed motor abnormality
Cause: When the paper feed motor/Up (M11) is active, an error detection signal of M11 is detected continuously for a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • DC power supply/2 (DCPS2) • Printer control board (PRCB) • Paper feed motor/Up (M11)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check that the front door is closed properly, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection between M11 and PRCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between M11 and DCPS2, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the IO Check (28-00) drive of M11 and the coupling of the gear, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (2/5): 4-N) 5. Replace M11. 6. Replace PRCB. 7. Replace DCPS2.

Classification: LU: LU paper feed motor abnormality
Cause: An error detection signal of M1 is detected continuously for a specified period of time while the paper feed motor (M1) is active.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • LU drive board (LUDB) • Paper feed motor (M1) • Interlock switch/1 (MS1), interlock switch/2 (MS2) • Upper door sensor (PS100), front door sensor (PS115)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - Be careful not to confuse the LUDB of LU-202m with the LUDB of LU-202XLm.
Solution: 1. LU-202m: Check the connector connection and the wiring between LUDB and M1, and repair it when there is any abnormality. LU-202XLm: Check the connector connection and the wiring harness between LUDB and M1, and if there is any abnormality, repair it. 2. LU-202m: Check IO Check (25-06) of MS1, IO Check (25-05) of MS2, Check PS100, PS115, and repair or replace if there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: LU-202m: 6-C, 8-B) U-202XLm: Check the IO Check (25-06) of MS1, the IO Check (25-05) of MS2, PS100, PS115, and repair or replace it if there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: LU-202XLm: 6-C, 8-B) 3. LU-202m: Check the M1 IO Check (28-01) drive or the coupling of the gear, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: LU-202m: 5-B) LU-202XLm: Check the M1 IO Check (28-01) drive or the coupling of the gear. Then repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: LU-202XLm: 5-A) 4. Replace M1. 5. LU-202m: Replace LUDB. LU-202XLm: Replace LUDB.
Control during the detachment: The LU paper feed is not available

Classification: PF: PF-602m paper feed motor abnormality
Cause: When the paper feed motor (M1) is active, an error detection signal of M1 is detected continuously for a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • PF drive board (PFDB) • Paper feed motor (M1) • Front door open close switch (SW1) • Front door open close sensor (PS23)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection and the wiring between PFDB and M1, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check IO Check (25-09) of SW1 and PS23, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality (Wiring diagram: PF: 9-U, 10-U) 3. Check IO Check (28-02) of M1 and the coupling of the gear, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: PF: 19-U) 4. Replace M1. 5. Replace PFDB.
Control during the detachment: The PF paper feed is not available

Classification: Main body: Paper feed motor abnormality
Cause: When the paper feed motor/Lw (M12) is active, an error detection signal of M12 is detected continuously for a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • DC power supply/2 (DCPS2) • Printer control board (PRCB) • Paper feed motor/Lw (M12)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection and the wiring among M12 and PRCB. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection and the wiring among M12 and DCPS2. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check IO Check (28-03) of M12 and the coupling of the gear, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (2/5): 4-N) 4. Replace M12. 5. Replace PRCB. 6. Replace DCPS2.

Classification: PF: PF-707m (1st tandem) loop motor abnormality
Cause: An error signal is detected while the loop motor/1 (M5) is activated.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Loop motor/1 (M5) • PF drive board (PFUDB)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection between PFUDB and M5 and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check IO Check (26-10) and others of M5 and the coupling of the gear, and repair or replace it and replace PFDB when there is any abnormality (Wiring diagram: PF (1/2): 12-F) 3. Replace M5. 4. Replace PFUDB.
Control during the detachment: The Paper feed in the tray 3-5 is unavailable.

Classification: FA-502 (1st tandem): Tandem conveyance motor abnormality
Cause: An error signal is detected while the tandem conveyance motor (M4) is activated.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • PFU drive board (PFUDB) • Tandem conveyance motor (M4)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (28-13) of the tandem conveyance motor (M4) (FA-502 1st tandem). 2. When the result of the IO Check in the step 1 is normal, M4 is not abnormal. Go on to step 4. For details of IO check results, refer to ""Table 1: Result check."" 3. Check the connector connection between PFUDB and M4, CN153 of PFUDB, CN230 of M4, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the coupling of the gear of M4, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace M4. 6. Replace PFUDB. Table 1: Result check Result check Normal Abnormal START 0 1 STOP Not care Not care
Faulty part isolation DIPSW: DIPSW35-3 to DIPSW35-5, DIPSW38-0 to DIPSW38-2
Control during the detachment: Paper feed in the tray 4 to the tray 9 is unavailable.

Cause: An error detection signal (blown clutch or solenoid fuse) of the MB drive board (MBDB) is detected while you print.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • MB drive board (MBDB)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (20-72) of the pick-up solenoid/BP (SD1). 2. When the result of the IO Check in step 1 is normal, SD1 is not abnormal. Go on to step 4. For details of IO check results, refer to ""Table 1: Result check."" 3. Check the connector connections between MBDB and SD1, CN732 of MBDB, CN796 of SD1, CN781 (relay connector), and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Execute the IO Check (20-73) of the paper feed clutch/BP (CL3). 5. When the result of the IO Check in step 4 is normal, CL3 is not abnormal. Go on to step 7. For details of IO check results, refer to ""Table 1: Result check."" 6. Check the connector connections between MBDB and CL3, CN732 of MBDB, CN795 of CL3, CN781 (relay connector), and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 7. Execute the IO Check (20-74) of the pre-registration clutch/BP (CL1). 8. When the result of the IO Check in step 7 is normal, CL1 is not abnormal. Go on to step 10. For details of IO check results, refer to ""Table 1: Result check."" 9. Check the connector connections between MBDB and CL1, CN731 of MBDB, CN786 of CL1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 10. Execute the IO Check (20-75) of the intermediate conveyance clutch/BP (CL2). 11. When the result of the IO Check in step 10 is normal, CL2 is not abnormal. Go on to step 13. For details of IO check results, refer to ""Table 1: Result check."" 12. Check the connector connections between MBDB and CL2, CN731 of MBDB, CN789 of CL2, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 13. Check SD1, CL1, CL2, and CL3. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 14. Replace MBDB. Table 1: Result check Result check Normal Abnormal START There is operating sound. There is no operating sound. STOP Not care Not care

Cause: When the reverse exit pressure home sensor (PS9) is active: Within a specified period of time after the decurler pressure release motor (M37) becomes active, PS9 does not become active. When PS9 is not active: Within a specified period of time after M37 becomes active, PS9 does not become active.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Conveyance drive board (CDB) • Decurler pressure release motor (M37) • Reverse exit pressure home sensor (PS9)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check that the front door is closed properly, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the reverse paper exit section, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the drive gear system in the reverse paper exit section, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection and the wiring between CDB, M37 and PS9, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the IO Check (86-18) and others of M37 or the coupling of the gear, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (1/5): 19-O) 6. Check the IO Check (86-18) and others and the operation of PS9, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (1/5): 21-O) 7. Replace PS9. 8. Replace M37. 9. Replace CDB. 10. Replace M37 and CDB at a time.

Classification: PF: PF-602m or PF-707m dehumidifier heater/1 high temperature abnormality (Hardware)

PF-602m: Replace HT-504 or HT-505. PF-707m: Replace HT-506. 6. PF-602m: Replace PFDB. PF-707m: Replace PFUDB.

PF-707m: Check the connector connection and the wiring between PFUDB and FM23, FM24, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. PF-602m: Check the connector connection and the wiring between PFDB and ACDB, and repair it when there is any abnormality. PF-707m: Check the connector connection and the wiring between PFDB and ACDB, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. PF-602m: Replace ACDB. PF-707m: Replace ACDB. 6. PF-602m: Replace PFDB. PF-707m: Replace PFUDB.

Classification: LU: LU-202m, LU-202XL temperature sensor abnormality
Cause: The temperature sensor/2 (TEMS2) detects an error detection signal continuously for a specified period of time. (Hardware detection)
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • LU drive board (LUDB) • Dehumidification heater/2 (DH2) • Temperature sensor/2 (TEMS2) • AC drive board (ACDB) • Main body DC power supply/1 (DCPS1)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection and the wiring between the LUDB, the TEMS2, and the AC Drive assy, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection and the wiring between the main body DCPS1 and the DH2, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the installation condition of TEMS2, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: LU-202m: 4-C) 4. Replace TEMS2. 5. Replace DH2. 6. Replace the AC drive board (ACDB). 7. Replace LUDB. 8. Replace DCPS1 of the main body.

Classification: LU-202XLm: Dehumidifier heater/2 (DH2) high temperature abnormality (Hardware)
Cause: The high temperature abnormality signal is detected continuously for a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • LU drive board (LUDB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (29-31) of the temperature sensor/2 (TEMS2). 2. When the result of the IO Check in the step 1 is normal, TEMS2 is not abnormal. Go on to step 4. For details of IO check results, refer to ""Table 1: Result check."" 3. Check the connector connection between TEMS2 and LUDB, CN835 of LUDB, CN938 (relay connector), CN958 of TEMS2, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between DH2 and the AC drive board (ACDB), CN969 of ACDB, CN972 (relay connector), CN915 of DH2, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the connector connection between LUDB and ACDB, CN963 of ACDB, CN973 (relay connector), CN962 of LUDB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Check the connector connection between the downstream option connecting section and ACDB, CN850 of ACDB, CN978 (relay connector), CN799 at the connecting section, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 7. Replace LUDB. Table 1: Result check Result check Normal Abnormal START 99 or less 100 or more STOP Not care Not care

Classification: FS or OT: FS-532 or OT-512
Cause: Communication error.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • FNS control board (FNSCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Turn OFF the sub power switch, and then turn OFF the main power switch. Then unplug all the power plug. Restart the main body after 10 seconds. 2. Check the connector connection and the wiring between the main body and each option, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. FS-532: Check the connector connection of FNSCB, and repair it when there is any abnormality. OT-512: Check the connector connection of FNSCB, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Rewrite the firmware of the option. 5. Replace the control board of the option corresponds to the malfunction code.

Cause: The main tray up down motor (M301) does not become inactive even when a specified period of time elapses after it starts operations. Alternatively, it operates for more than the allowed time at a speed out of the specified one.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • FNS control board (FNSCB) • Main tray up down motor (M301) • Tray upper limit LED (LED1) • Main tray upper limit sensor (PS051)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the tray up and down section, and clean or repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection between FNSCB and M301, CN38 of FNSCB, CN111 of M301, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between FNSCB and LED1, CN46 of FNSCB, CN79 (Relay connector), CN140 of LED1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between FNSCB and PS051, CN46 of FNSCB, CN154 of PS051, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the IO Check (72-11), LED emission, and the light-receiving path of PS051, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Check the IO Check (72-15) of M301 and the coupling of the gear, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 7. Replace LED1 and PS051. 8. Replace M301. 9. Replace FNSCB.
Control during the detachment: FS main tray and stapling are not available

Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • FNS control board (FNSCB) • Stack assist motor (M107) • Stack assist home sensor (PS107)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection between FNSCB and M107, CN35 of FNSCB, CN135 (Relay connector), CN108 of M107, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection between FNSCB and PS107, CN45 of FNSCB, CN194 (Relay connector), CN151 of PS107, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the IO Check (72-08) of M107 and the coupling of the gear, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the IO Check (72-08) of PS107 or the operation, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace PS107. 6. Replace M107. 7. Replace FNSCB.

Cause: RUKA communication error
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • FNS control board (FNSCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Deactivate the sub power switch, and then become inactive the main power switch. Then unplug all the power plug. Restart the main body after 10 seconds. 2. Check the connector connection and the wiring between the main body and each option, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection of FNSCB, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Rewrite the firmware of the option. 5. Replace the control board of the option corresponds to the malfunction code.

Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the folding sub scan alignment exit section, and clean or repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection between SDDB and M8and the wiring, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between SDDB and SDCB and the wiring, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check IO Check (71-27) of M8 and the coupling of the gear, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: SD-506: 10-D) 5. Replace M8. 6. Replace SDDB. (Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.21.2 SD drive board (SDDB)) 7. Replace SDCB. (Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.21.1 SD control board (SDCB))
Control during the detachment: The use of the saddle stitching, multi center folding, multi tri-folding and trimmer are unavailable.

Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection between PCB2 and FM4, and the wiring. Then, repair them when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: SD-513 (1/2): 4-N) 2. Check the connector connection between PCB2 and PCB1, and the wiring. Then repair them when there is any abnormality. 3. Rotate FM4 by IO Check (71-13) or hand, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace FM4. 5. Replace PCB2. (Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.22.2 SD drive board (PCB2)) 6. Replace PCB1. (Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.22.1 SD control board (PCB1))
Faulty part isolation DIPSW: DIPSW7-0, DIPSW7-1, DIPSW7-2, DIPSW7-3, DIPSW54-3, DIPSW54-7
Control during the detachment: The uses of the fold & staple, multi half-fold, multi tri-fold, fore-edge trimming, reverse stacker, slitter, and staple error (non-staple) detection are unavailable.

Cause: A rotation error detection signal is detected continuously for a specified period of time while the cover paper tray fan/1 (FM71) is started or driving.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.

Solution: 1. Check the connector connection and the wiring between PBDB1 and FM71, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. (Connector layout drawing in board : L.2.25.3 PB drive board/1 (PBDB1)) 5. Replace PBCB. (Connector layout drawing in board : L.2.25.1 PB control board (PBCB))
Faulty part isolation DIPSW: DIPSW 7-5 Control while detached Paper feed from the PB is unavailable.

Classification: FS or OT: FS-532 or OT-512 abnormality
Cause: Non-volatile memory abnormality.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • FNS control board (FNSCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Deactivate the sub power switch and the main power switch, and then unplug the power plug of the main body. Then Restart the main body after 10 seconds. 2. FS-532: Check the connector connection of FNSCB and the wiring, and repair it when there is any abnormality. OT-512: Check the connector connection of FNSCB and the wiring, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Reinstalling FS firmware 4. FS-532: Replace FNSCB. OT-512: Replace FNSCB.

Cause: When the front console open close sensor (PS47), the entrance section door sensor (PS62), the saddle stitching section door sensor (PS63), the booklet tray section door sensor (PS124), or the sub tray open close sensor (PS127) is inactive, the 24VDC is supplied.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Front console open close sensor (PS47) • Entrance section door sensor (PS62) • Saddle stitching section door sensor (PS63) • Booklet tray section door sensor (PS124) • Sub tray open close sensor (PS127) • SD drive board (PCB2) • SD control board (PCB1)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the setting positions of the door and the scraps box. If there is any abnormality, clean or repair them. 2. Check the connector connection and the wiring harness between PCB1 and PS47, PS62, PS63, PS124, PS127. Then, repair them when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: SD-513 (1/2): 11-B, 23-B, SD-513 (2/2): 9-O, 14-O, 18-O) 3. Check the connector connection and the wiring harness between PCB2 and PCB1, and if there is any abnormality, repair them. 4. Check PS47 of IO Check (71-56), PS62 of IO Check (71-20), PS63 of IO Check (71-58), PS124 of IO Check (71-74), PS127 of IO Check (71-48) and the operation to repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace PS47, PS62, PS63, PS124, or PS127. 6. Replace PCB2. (Connector layout drawing in board : L.2.22.2 SD drive board (PCB2)) 7. Replace PCB1. (Connector layout drawing in board : L.2.22.1 SD control board (PCB1))

Check IO Check (73-27) of PS127, IO Check (73-41) of PS126, IO Check (73-43) of PS130, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace PS127. 6. Replace PS126. 7. Replace PS130. 8. Replace PCB1.
Control during the detachment: The use of the tandem (1st) LS is unavailable.

Cause: The initial operation is not completed within a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Stacker tray lower limit sensor (PS120) • Paper exit tray home sensor (PS121) • Paper exit tray upper limit sensor (PS123) • Paper exit tray lower limit sensor (PS124) • Paper exit completion position sensor (PS132) • 2,000 sheets stacked sensor (PS133) • Stacker tray ejection position sensor (PS135) • Stacker tray deceleration sensor (PS138) • Conveyance motor/1 (M001) • Conveyance motor/2 (M002) • Conveyance motor/3 (M003) • Conveyance motor/4 (M004) • Steering motor/Rr (M051) • Steering motor/Fr (M052) • 1st gate solenoid (SD001) • 2nd gate solenoid (SD002) • Gripper motor (M106) • Shift motor (M107) • Alignment plate up down motor/Rr (M109) • Paper trailing edge presser motor (M110) • Leading edge guide motor (M111) • Alignment plate up down motor/Fr (M112) • Alignment plate drive motor/Rr (M181) • Alignment plate drive motor/Fr (M182) • Trailing edge guide plate retracting motor (M183) • Paper leading edge stopper motor (M184) • Stacker tray up down motor (M313) • Ejection tray up down motor (M316) • Ejection tray drive motor (M114) • Ejection gate drive motor (M115)
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check IO Check to see whether any of the following sensors are active at the same time and repair it when there is any abnormality. • Two or more of the following: IO Check (73-23) of PS120, IO Check (73-03) of PS133, IO Check (73-45) of PS135, or IO Check (73-02) of PS138 • Both of IO Check (73-13) of PS121 and IO Check (73-14) of PS132 • Both of IO Check (73-25) of PS123 and IO Check (73-26) of PS124 2. Check the IO Check of each part and the related sensors, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between each part and the related sensors, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace each part and the related sensors. 5. Replace PCB1.

Check the connector connection and the wiring between PBDB1 and M33, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the IO Check (79-04) and others of M33 and the coupling of the gear, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Connector layout drawing in board : L.2.25.3 PB drive board/1 (PBDB1)) 6. Replace PBCB. (Connector layout drawing in board : L.2.25.1 PB control board (PBCB))

Cause: After the conveyance route switch motor (M55) starts the home position search operation, the conveyance gate home sensor (PS75) does not become active within a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Conveyance gate home sensor (PS75) • Conveyance route switch motor (M55) • SD drive board (PCB2) • SD control board (PCB1)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the tri-fold paper exit gate drive section, and if there is any abnormality, clean or repair it. 2. Check the connector connection between PCB2 and M55, PCB1 and PS75, and the wiring. Then, repair them when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: SD-513 (1/2): 5-N) (Wiring diagram: SD-513 (1/2): 15-B) 3. Check the connector connection between PCB2 and PCB1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the IO Check (71-44) of M55 and the coupling of the gear, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the IO Check (71-42) of PS75 and the operation. Then repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 6. Replace PS75. 7. Replace M55. 8. Replace PCB2. (Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.22.2 SD drive board (PCB2)) 9. Replace PCB1. (Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.22.1 SD control board (PCB1))
Control during the detachment: The use of multi tri-fold and the sub tray are unavailable.

Cause: When the power is active, the trimmer shutter open close sensor (PS93) is inactive while the trimmer scraps box set sensor (PS48) is inactive. Alternatively, PS93 does not become active even after a specified period of time after PS48 becomes inactive.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Trimmer scraps box set sensor (PS48) • Trimmer shutter open close sensor (PS93) • SD control board (PCB1)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the setting position of the trimmer scraps box, and if there is any abnormality, clean or repair it. 2. Check if trimmer scraps are caught in the trimmer shutter. If there is any abnormality, clean or repair it. 3. Check the connector connection between PCB1, PS48 and PS93, and the wiring. Then, repair them when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: SD-513 (2/2): 9-O, 10-O) 4. Check the IO Check (71-79) of PS48, IO Check (71-87) of PS93 and the operation, and repair or replace them when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace PS48 or PS93. 6. Replace PCB1. (Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.22.1 SD control board (PCB1))
Control during the detachment: The use of SD is unavailable

Cause: While the slit scraps box set sensor (PS106) is inactive, the slitter shutter open close sensor (PS110) is inactive.

Solution: 1. Check the setting position of the slit scraps box, and if there is any abnormality, clean or repair it. 2. Check the connector connection between PCB1, PS106 and PS110, and the wiring. Then, repair them when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: SD-513 (1/2): 12-B, TU-503: 1-D) 3. Check the IO Check (71-28) of PS106, IO Check (71-91) of PS110 and the operation, and repair or replace them when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace PS106 or PS110. 5. Replace PCB1. (Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.22.1 SD control board (PCB1))
Control during the detachment: The use of SD is unavailable

Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.

Solution: 1. Check around the water supply tank. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the IO Check (66-35) of PS13, the IO check (66-28) of SD4 and water leak. Replace PS13. 6. Replace SD4. 7. Replace PCB1. (Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.9.1 RU control board (PCB1))

Estimated abnormal parts: • RU control board (PCB1)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Deactivate the sub power switch and the main power switch, and then unplug the power plug of the main body. Then Restart the main body after 10 seconds. 2. Check the connector connection of PCB1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Reinstall the RU-518m firmware. 4. Replace PCB1. (Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.9.1 RU control board (PCB1))

(Connector layout drawing in board: L.2.9.1 RU control board (PCB1))

Estimated abnormal parts: • TU control board (PCB1) • Scraps leveling motor (M136)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection between PCB1 and PS225, CN123A of PCB1, CN478 (Relay connector), and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection between PCB1 and M136, CN120 of PCB1, CN320 (Relay connector), CN297 of M136, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the IO Check (65-13) and the IO Check (65-14) of M136 and the coupling of the gear. Then repair or replace them when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace M136. 5. Replace PCB1.

Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • Drum motor/Y (M1) • Encoder sensor/Y1 (PS52), Encoder sensor/Y2 (PS53) • DC power supply/2 (DCPS2)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the IO Check (41-00) and others of the M1 and the coupling of the gear. Then repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (2/5): 15-N) 2. Check the connector connection between PRCB, and M1 and PS52, PS53, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between DCPS2 and PRCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace PS52 and PS53. 5. Replace M1. 6. Replace PRCB. 7. Replace DCPS2.

Classification: Main body: TCR set detection/Y abnormality
Cause: After the front door is closed, an error detection signal of the TCR sensor/Y (TCRS1) is detected continuously for a specified period of time. Alternatively, the value of TCRS1 is detected as 0 continuously for a specified number of times.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • TCR sensor/Y (TCRS1) • Printer control board (PRCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (58-00) of the TCR sensor/Y (TCRS1). 2. When the result of the IO Check in the step 1 is normal, TCRS1, PRCB, and the wiring are not abnormal. Go on to step 4. For details of IO check results, refer to ""Table 1: Result check."" 3. Check the connector connection between PRCB and TCRS1, CN121 of PRCB, CN241 (Relay connector), CN482 (Relay connector), CN242 (Relay connector), CN221 of TCRS1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace TCRS1. 5. Replace PRCB. Table 1: Result check Result check Normal Abnormal START 1 or more 0 STOP 1 or more 0

Classification: Main body: TCR sensor/Y initial adjustment abnormality (low density)
Cause: When the initial adjustment is performed with the TCR sensor/Y (TCRS1), the output value of TCRS1 lowers the prescribed value.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • Developing motor/Y (M5) • TCR sensor/Y (TCRS1)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check that the process unit is correctly installed without looseness, and reinstall or repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check TCRS1, and clean or repair it when there is dirt or any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (2/5): 22-F) 3. Check the developing section, and clean or repair it if there is a sensor dirt or any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between PRCB and TCRS1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the connector connection between PRCB and M5, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Rotate M5 by IO Check (50-00) and others, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (2/5): 20-E) 7. Replace TCRS1. 8. Replace M5. 9. Replace PRCB.

Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • Developing motor/K (M8) • TCR sensor/K (TCRS3)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check that the process unit is correctly installed without looseness, and reinstall or repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check TCRS3, and clean or repair it when there is dirt or any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (2/5): 23-F) 3. Check the developing section, and clean or repair it if there is a sensor dirt or any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between PRCB and TCRS3, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the connector connection between PRCB and M8, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Rotate M8 with the IO Check (50-15) and other method. Then repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (2/5): 18-E) 7. Replace TCRS3. 8. Replace M8. 9. Replace PRCB.

Classification: Main body: High voltage unit/1 abnormality
Cause: An error detection signal of the charging corona/Y is detected while the charging corona/Y is activated. The signal is detected even after you activate and deactivate the charging corona/Y for a prescribed time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • High voltage unit/1 (HV1) • Charging corona/Y • Printer control board (PRCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connection of the high voltage contact of the process unit, and clean or repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the charger (charging wire and the grid), and clean or repair it if there is any dirt or abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between HV1 and the charger, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (3/5): 3-M) 4. Check the connector connection between PRCB and HV1, and the wiring. Classification: Main body: IDC sensor/Fr light volume detection abnormality
Cause: When the rough adjustment ends during the IDC sensor/Fr (IDCS1) base correction, it is detected that the IDC sensor/Fr (IDCS1) output value is out of the specified value.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • IDC sensor/Fr (IDCS1) • IDC sensor shutter solenoid (SD4) • Intermediate transfer belt
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check that the process unit is correctly installed without looseness, and reinstall or repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check that the belt cleaner blades the intermediate transfer section is not curled and reinstall or repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the intermediate transfer belt, and clean or replace it if there is any dirt or abnormality. 4. Check the IDC sensor and clean it if the sensor is dirty. 5. Check the connector connection between PRCB and IDCS1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Check the IO Check (55-00) of SD4 and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 7. Replace IDCS1. 8. Replace PRCB.

Check the connector connection between PRCB and IDCS1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Replace IDCS1. 7. Replace PRCB. 8. Replace IDCS1 and PRCB at a time.

Cause: During the pressing operation: Within a specified period of time after the fusing pressure release motor (M47) becomes active, the fusing pressure position sensor/2 (PS25) or the fusing pressure position sensor/3 (PS26) does not become active. Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • Fusing pressure release motor (M47) • Fusing pressure position sensor/1 (PS24) • Fusing pressure position sensor/2 (PS25) • Fusing pressure position sensor/3 (PS26)

Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the IO Check (47-05) and others of M47 and the coupling of the gear. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (1/5): 3-M) 6. Check IO Check (47-05) of PS24, IO Check (47-06) of PS26, IO Check (47-07) of PS25 and the operation of PS24, PS25, PS26, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (1/5): 3-L, 3-M) 7. Replace PS24, PS25 and PS26. 8. Replace M47. 9. Replace PRCB.

Cause: When the 2nd transfer roller pressure release home sensor (PS19) is active: Within a specified period of time after the 2nd transfer pressure release motor (M38) becomes active, PS19 does not become inactive. Replace M38. 8. Refer to the ""Parts guide manual"" (duplex mount section) and replace the wiring (A50UN15500,A50UN18700: ADU pantograph section) (Wiring diagram: Main body (1/5): 13-J) 9. Replace CDB. 10. Replace FM38 and CDB at the same time.

Cause: The fusing unit of the C3080 series is attached.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Fusing unit
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the inserted fusing unit, and replace it when it is for the C3080 series. 2. Check the connector connection between the fusing unit and PRCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality.

Classification: Main body: Fusing roller paper wrap abnormality

Replace PS22. 7. Replace FM10, FM11, and FM12. 8. Replace CDB. 9. Replace PRCB. 10. Replace the fusing unit.

Classification: Main body: Intermediate transfer belt paper wrap abnormality
Cause: • When J-3102 or J-3104 occurs, the fusing loop sensor (PS23) never becomes active within the detection period. • It will be displayed only when DipSW 174-1 is set to ""0"".
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Fusing loop sensor (PS23)
Correction: WARNING Be sure to select the DIPSW3-1 to 0 after you replace the defective parts. If DIPSW3-1 is set to 0 before defective parts are fixed, it may cause fire.
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Prior check • Check that there is no remaining paper on the intermediate transfer belt. 2. Execute the IO Check (47-14) of the fusing loop sensor (PS23). 3. When the result of the IO Check in the step 2 is normal, PS23 is not abnormal. For details of IO check results, refer to ""Table 1: Result check."" 4. Check the connector connection between the conveyance drive board (CDB) and PS23, CN167 of CDB, CN397 (relay connector), CN460 (fusing unit), CN414 of PS23, and the wiring. Then, repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace PS23. Table 1: Result check Result check Normal Abnormal START - - STOP 0 1

Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the writing unit, and replace it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection between PRCB and the writing unit, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between DCPS2 and the writing unit, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check IO Check (32-01) of M21, and replace the writing unit when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace the writing unit. 6. Replace PRCB. 7. Replace DCPS2.

Classification: Main body: Response time out abnormality of color registration image process
Cause: Time out occurs before the machine receives a response from color registration image process.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. When SC occurs, store the log with the ""Log Store"" in the service mode. 2. Report it to KM with the log data.

Cause: The color registration base line correction/Fr has terminated abnormally.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • IDC sensor/Fr (IDCS1) • IDC sensor shutter solenoid (SD4) • Intermediate transfer belt
Note: - The output check on the IO check mode has restrictive conditions. Check the IO check mode list before the output check. 5. Replace IDCS1. 6. Replace PRCB. 7. Replace SD4 and PRCB at a time.
Solution: 1. Check the shutter and around the IDC sensor, and clean or replace it if there is any dirt or abnormality. 2. Check the intermediate transfer belt, and clean or replace it if there is any dirt or abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between PRCB and IDCS1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the IO Check (36-03) of IDCS1 with the IO Check (55-00) of SD4, and the operation, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: Main body (2/5): 16-I)

Cause: The histogram processing of the Y toner has terminated abnormally on the IDC sensor/Fr (IDCS1).
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board • IDC sensor/Fr (IDCS1) • IDC sensor shutter solenoid (SD4) • Intermediate transfer belt
Note: - The output check on the IO check mode has restrictive conditions. Check the IO check mode list before the output check. 5. Replace SD4. 6. Replace IDCS1. 7. Replace PRCB.
Solution: 1. Output the test pattern. Check whether the uneven density occurs on the Y toner area. 2. Check the intermediate transfer belt, and clean or replace it when there is any toner image, damage, or abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between PRCB and IDCS1, SD4, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Perform a visual check and IO Check (36-03) of IDCS1, IO Check (55-00) of SD4, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality.

Classification: Main body: Color registration correction abnormality (Y)
Cause: The color registration correction/Y has terminated abnormally.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board • IDC sensor/Fr (IDCS1) • IDC sensor/Rr (IDCS2) • IDC sensor shutter solenoid (SD4) • Intermediate transfer belt
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The output check on the IO check mode has restrictive conditions. Check the IO check mode list before the output check. 7. Replace SD4. 8. Replace IDCS1 or IDCS2. 9. Replace PRCB.
Solution: 1. Check the intermediate transfer belt, and clean or replace it when there is any dirt or abnormality. 2. Perform the color registration automatic adjustment. 3. When the error 2 occurs, acquire the log and analyze it. 4. When the error 1 occurs, it means that the color registration error level is not abnormal but not good. In this case, the error is cleared when the machine returns to the normal mode. However it possibly occurs again. 5. Check the connector connection between PRCB and IDCS1, IDCS2, SD4, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Perform a visual check and IO Check (36-03) of IDCS1, IO Check (36-04) of IDCS2, IO Check (55-00) of SD4, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality.

Classification: Main body: Color registration correction watch completion (specified number of errors)
Cause: The color registration correction is completed in the watch area 5 times in succession.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • IDC sensor/Fr (IDCS1) • IDC sensor/Rr (IDCS2) • Printer control board (PRCB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - Do not deactivate and activate the main power until you acquire the log data.
Solution: 1. Replace IDCS1. 2. Replace IDCS2. 3. Replace PRCB. 4. Report it to Konica Minolta with the log data.

Classification: Main body: Color registration correction abnormality during the image diagnosis
Cause: The front door opened during the color registration correction of the image diagnosis, or SCs such as C-45xx and C-46xx that are related to other color registration abnormalities are detected.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Note: - Do not deactivate and activate the main power until you acquire the log data.
Solution: 1. If any of the front doors had opened during the image diagnosis, close all the front doors, and conduct the image diagnosis again. 2. Execute [Service Mode] - [Machine Adjustment] - [Printer Adjustment] - [Color Registration Auto. Adj.]. 3. If an error occurs, resolve it according to the error type. ( I.4.3.11 Color Registration Auto.Adj. (Printer Adjustment)) 4. When you retry the image diagnosis and the error is detected again, store the log in either of the following measures. - [Service] - [Log Store] - [Execute Log Storing] - [Log+IQ Image Manual Store] - [UTILITY] - [System Information] - [Store Log & IQ Image] 5. Report it with that log to KMBT.

Cause: When the machine is writing the image: Within a specified period of time, the expansion processing from the memory to the printer does not terminate. Within a specified period of time, the output from the page memory to the printer does not terminate. Within a specified period of time, the PVV is not detected.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Prior check • Check that the CN5402 of IPB is correctly connected. 2. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 3 and solution 4. 3. Check the connector connection between the writing unit and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace IPB.

Cause: APC abnormality. The laser does not become active because 12 VDC power source for driving laser is not fed, MPC is wrong, or the laser is defective.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Writing unit/Y
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with the writing unit (only LDB1 to LDB4) or IPB. • When the results are abnormal for LDB1 to LDB4, perform solution 2 and solution 3. • When the results are abnormal for IPB, perform solution 2 and solution 4. • When all of the results are normal, perform solution 2 and solution 3. 2. Check the connector connection between IPB and the writing unit, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Replace the writing unit. 4. Replace IPB.

Cause: Connection abnormality between the index board/Y (INDEXB1) or the laser drive board/Y (LDB1) and the image processing board (IPB).
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Writing unit/Y
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Prior check • Close the toner supply door properly. • Close the front door properly. (Check with the IO Check (25-00) of the front door sensor (PS31).) 2. Execute the IO Check (37-20). • When the result is [OK]: Go on to the step 3. • When the result is [Err1]: Replace IPB. • When the result is [Err2]: Go on to the step 4. 3. Check the connection condition between IPB and the writing unit. • Check the connector connection between IPB and LDB1, CN1100 of IPB, CN1814 of LDB1, and the wiring. Then, repair it when there is any abnormality. • Check the connector connection between IPB and LDB2, CN1200 of IPB, CN1813 of LDB2, and the wiring. Then, repair it when there is any abnormality. • Check the connector connection between IPB and LDB3, CN2100 of IPB, CN1812 of LDB3, and the wiring. Then, repair it when there is any abnormality. • Check the connector connection between IPB and LDB4, CN2200 of IPB, CN1811 of LDB4, and the wiring. Then, repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Disconnect CN1814 of LDB1, CN1813 of LDB2, CN1812 of LDB3, and CN1811 of LDB4. Then, execute the IO Check (37-23). • When the result is [OK]: Go on to the step 5. • When the result is [Err]: Replace IPB. 5. Connect only CN1814 of LDB1. Then, execute the IO Check (37-26). • When the result is [OK]: Go on to the step 6. • When the result is [Err]: Replace the writing unit/Y. 6. Disconnect CN1814 of LDB1, and then connect only CN1813 of LDB2. Classification: Main body: Out of register abnormality
Cause: VTOP signals are input twice or more for 1 page. Alternatively, input timing of the VTOP signal is not normal.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Wiring (AC57N104) • Image processing board (IPB) • Printer control board (PRCB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of IPB. • When the results are OK: Go on to the following steps. • When the result is NG: There is an abnormality in IPB or the connection. Go on to the step 5. 2. Prior check • Check that the CN5402 of IPB is correctly connected. 3. Check the connector connection between PRCB and IPB, CN107 of PRCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace the wiring. 5. Replace IPB. 6. Replace PRCB.

Classification: Main body: VbyOne initialization abnormality (Between YM-CK)
Cause: A VbyOne training error is detected.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of IPB. • When the result is NG: There is an abnormality in IPB or the connection. 2. Replace IPB.

Cause: When the expansion preparation from the memory to the printer is completed, WVV becomes active.

Prior check • Check that the CN5402 of IPB is correctly connected. 3. Check the connector connection between PRCB and IPB, CN107 of PRCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace the wiring. 5. Replace IPB. 6. Replace PRCB.

Classification: Main body: Color registration adjustment abnormality
Cause: When the color registration mark of the color registration auto adjustment is detected, the printing ratio of the last downstream becomes 0.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of IPB. • When the results are OK: Go on to the following steps. • When the result is NG: There is an abnormality in IPB or the connection. Go on to the step 3. 2. Check the connector connection between the printer control board (PRCB) and IPB, CN5402 of IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Replace IPB.

Cause: • When the malfunction code occurs during the gamma auto adjustment operation: Color registration adjustment value abnormality. • When the malfunction code occurs during the color registration auto adjustment operation: Polygon drive system abnormality, sensor system abnormality, or printer clock system abnormality. • When the malfunction code occurs during the output operation: Non-volatile abnormality • When the malfunction code occurs during the first printing after you changed the adjustment value of the Beam Pitch Adjustment: Adjustment value abnormality, writing unit abnormality.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Semiconductor laser relay wiring (AC57N265) • Writing unit/Y • Image processing board (IPB) • NVRAM board (NRB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: <When abnormality occurs during the gamma auto adjustment operation> 1. Carry out the beam pitch adjustment. 2. Carry out the color registration auto adjustment. 3. Carry out the gamma auto adjustment. <When abnormality occurs during the color registration auto adjustment operation> 1. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of IPB and the writing unit/Y (laser drive board/Y (LDB1)). • When the result of IPB is NG: There is an abnormality in IPB or the connection. Go on to the step 5. • When the result of the writing unit/Y is NG: There is an abnormality in LDB1 or the connection. Go on to the following steps. 2. Prior check • Close the toner supply door properly. • Close the front door properly. (Check with the IO Check (25-00) of the front door sensor (PS31).) • The color registration auto adjustment is completed normally. 3. Check the connector connection between IPB and LDB1, CN1100 of IPB, CN1814 of LDB1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace the writing unit/Y. 5. Replace IPB. <When abnormality occurs during the output operation> 1. Check the connector connection of NRB, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Replace NRB. <When the malfunction code occurs during the first printing after you changed the adjustment value of the Beam Pitch Adjustment> 1. When you input an inappropriate large value (example: +50, -100) to the Beam Pitch Adjustment: Configure the adjustment value of the Beam Pitch Adjustment to 0 once. Then, perform the Beam Pitch Adjustment again with the correct procedure (using the test chart). 2. When you input an appropriate value to the Beam Pitch Adjustment with the correct procedure (using the test chart): Replace the writing unit/Y.

Classification: Main body: Abnormality of the continuous drive of the engine
Cause: The engine section keeps operating continuously for a specified period of time without producing the image or the process patch.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Deactivate and activate the main power switch (SW1) of the main body.

Cause: The overall control software accesses an illegal address.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Deactivate and activate the main power switch (SW1) of the main body.

Cause: The UK control software accesses an illegal address.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Restart the main body and the UK-301. (Deactivate the sub power of the main body, the main power of the main body, and the main power of the UK-301. Activate the main power of the UK-301. Activate the main power of the main body, and the sub power of the main body.)

Classification: Main body: Segmentation fault (IQ control board)
Cause: The IQ control board (PCB1) accesses an illegal address.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Restart the main body and the IQ-501. (Deactivate the sub power of the main body, and the main power of the main body. Activate the main power of the main body, and the sub power of the main body.)

Cause: When an HDD Read or Write error occurs.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of IPB. • When the result of IPB is NG: There is an abnormality in IPB or the connection. 2. Replace IPB.

Cause: When a timeout occurs in image data transfer.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Prior check • When an abnormal code occurs, be sure to deactivate and activate the main power of both the main body and the controller. • Reconnect or replace the cable between the controller and the UK-301. • Reconnect or replace the communication cable that is connected to the image processing board (IPB) and the controller. • The firmware for the image control system, the controller, and the network control is the latest. • When you connect an external controller, be sure that the latest firmware and patch are applied. In addition, DIPSW 114-3 must be ""1"". 2. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of IPB. • When the result of IPB is NG: There is an abnormality in IPB or the connection. 3. Replace IPB.

Classification: Main body: DMA16 (YMCK) VV length abnormality
Cause: The input image size that is notified by the controller and the image size that is actually transferred (YMCK-VV length) does not match.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Prior check • The cable is connected between the controller and the main body. • The power of the controller is not deactivated. Reconnect the communication cable that is connected to the image processing board (IPB). • The firmware for the image control system, the controller, and the network control is the latest. 2. Replace IPB.

Classification: Main body: DMA16 (YMCK) HV length abnormality
Cause: The input image size that is notified by the controller and the image size that is actually transferred (YMCK-HV length) does not match.

Classification: Main body: Printer control board 24 V1 abnormality
Cause: Printer control board (PRCB) 24 V1 DC abnormality. An error signal is detected continuously for a specified period of time after the sub power switch (SW2) is activated.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • DC power supply/1 (DCPS1) • Each loading of PRCB connection (motor, solenoid and clutch)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Disconnect CN100 on PRCB to boot the main body, and check the 24 V output of CN100-2 and CN100-3. 2. If there is no 24 V output, check the connector connection and the wiring of PRCB and DCPS1. Repair it when there is any abnormality. If no abnormality exists, replace DCPS1. 3. Replace PRCB when the output is 24 V. 4. Check the loading of PRCB connection (the motor, the solenoid, and the clutch), and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace PRCB and DCPS1 at a time.

Classification: Main body: Conveyance drive board 24 V abnormality
Cause: Conveyance drive board (CDB) 24 V DC abnormality. An error signal of 24 V DC for CDB is detected.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • DC power supply/2 (DCPS2) • Conveyance drive board (CDB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check that the front door is closed properly, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection between DCPS2 and CDB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Replace DCPS2. 4. Replace CDB. 5. Replace DCPS2 and CDB at a time.

Classification: Main body: Printer control board 24 V2 abnormality
Cause: Printer control board (PRCB) 24 V2 DC abnormality. An error signal is detected after a specified period of time elapses since the sub power switch (SW2) is activated.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • DC power supply/2 (DCPS2) • Each loading of PRCB connection (motor, solenoid and clutch)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Disconnect CN100 on PRCB, boot the main body, and check the 24 V output of CN100-4. 2. If there is no 24 V output, check the connector connection and the wiring of PRCB and DCPS2. Repair it when there is any abnormality. If no abnormality exists, replace DCPS2. 3. Replace PRCB when the output is 24 V. 4. Check the loading of PRCB connection (the motor, the solenoid, and the clutch), and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace PRCB and DCPS2 at a time.

Classification: Main body: Printer control board 24 V3 abnormality
Cause: Printer control board (PRCB) 24 V3 DC abnormality. An error signal is detected after a specified period of time elapses since the sub power switch (SW2) is activated.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • DC power supply/2 (DCPS2) • Each loading of PRCB connection (motor, solenoid and clutch)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check that the front door is closed properly, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the operation of the front door switch (MS1), and repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Disconnect CN101 on PRCB, boot the main body, and check the 24 V output of CN101-1. 4. If there is no 24 V output, check the connector connection and the wiring of PRCB and DCPS2. Repair it when there is any abnormality. If no abnormality exists, replace DCPS2. 5. Replace PRCB when the output is 24 V. 6. Check the loading of PRCB connection (the motor, the solenoid, and the clutch), and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 7. Replace PRCB and DCPS2 at a time.

Classification: Main body: Printer control board 5 V abnormality
Cause: Printer control board (PRCB) 5 V DC abnormality An error signal is detected continuously for a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Printer control board (PRCB) • DC power supply/2 (DCPS2)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Disconnect CN100 on PRCB, boot the main body, and check the 5 V output of CN100-1. Replace PRCB when the output is 5 V. 2. Check the connector connection between PRCB and DCPS2, CN100 of PRCB, CN4PU2 of DCPS2, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection of PRCB, CN107 of PRCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection of DCPS2, CN2PU2 of DCPS2, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check each of the sensors that are connecting. Then repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 6. Replace PRCB. 7. Replace DCPS2.

Cause: Within a specified period of time after the scanner motor (M201) becomes active during the home position search operation, the scanner home sensor (PS201) does not become inactive. Alternatively, on the home position search operation, within a specified period of time after the scanner motor (M201) becomes active, the scanner home sensor (PS201) does not become active.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Overall control board (OACB) • Scanner drive board (SCDB) • Scanner motor (M201) • Scanner home sensor (PS201)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 5, solution 6, and solution 11. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 11. 2. Check the drive section of the scanner (the wire, the pulley, the gear and the belt), and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 3. Move to [Machine Adjustment] - [Scan Adjustment] - [Sensor Check] to check the condition of PS201, and repair or replace it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between PS201 or M201 and SCDB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. (Refer to Main body (3/5): 19-J, 20-J) 5. Check the connector connection between SCDB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Check the connector connection between IPB and OACB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 7. Replace PS201. 8. Replace M201. 9. Replace SCDB. 10. Replace OACB. 11. Replace IPB.

Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 2, solution 3, solution 4, and solution 8. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 8. 2. Check the connector connection between CCDB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between SCDB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between IPB and OACB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace CCDB. 6. Replace SCDB. 7. Replace OACB. 8. Replace IPB.

Cause: The initial communication with the scanner is not completed within a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Overall control board (OACB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 2 and solution 4. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 4. 2. Check the connector connection between OACB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Replace OACB. 4. Replace IPB.

Cause: The paper passes from the DF and during the initial move operation from the home position. In addition, within a specified period of time after the CIS cleaning motor (M7) becomes active, the CIS cleaning sensor (PS9) does not become inactive. In the other case, on home position search, within a specified period of time after M7 becomes active, PS9 does not become active.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Overall control board (OACB) • DF control board (DFCB) • CIS cleaning motor (M7) • CIS cleaning sensor (PS9)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 3, solution 4, and solution 9. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 9. 2. Check the connector connection between M7 or PS9 and DFCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between DFCB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between IPB and OACB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace PS7. 6. Replace M7. 7. Replace DFCB. 8. Replace OACB. 9. Replace IPB.

Classification: Main body: Image processing board abnormality
Cause: The image processing board cannot be detected in the configuration process of the image processing board at the startup.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of IPB. • When the results are OK: Go on to the following steps. • When the result is NG: There is an abnormality in IPB or the connection. 2. Prior check • Check if there is any problem with the connector connection of IPB. 3. Replace the overall control board (OACB) and the image processing board (IPB) at the same time. 4. Execute the IO Check (99-98).

Cause: There was no communication from the overall control board (OACB) for a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Overall control board (OACB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection of OACB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality.

Classification: Main Body: CCD clamp gain adjustment abnormality
Cause: When the CCD clamp is adjusted, the adjustment value becomes 0 or 255. Alternatively, when the CCD gain is adjusted, the peak value of the output data becomes 64 or less.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • CCD board (CCDB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 2 and solution 7. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 7. 2. Check the connector connection between CCDB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the cause of the external light, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Clean the lens, the mirror, the CCD surface and the shading plate when there is any dirt. 5. Check the condition of the mirror installation on the scanner, and repair it or replace the scanner when there is any abnormality. 6. Replace CCDB. 7. Replace IPB.

Check the connector connection between IPB and CCDB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Replace CCDB. 4. Replace IPB.
