Classification: Min body: CIS gain adjustment abnormality

Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.

Check the connector connection between IPB and CIS, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace CIS. 5. Replace IPB.

Classification: Main body: CCD power pressure abnormality
Cause: Within a specified period of time at the startup, the CCD power ON is not checked.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.

Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 3 and solution 8. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 8. 3. Replace SCDB. 8. Replace IPB. 9. Replace DCPS1.

Classification: UK-301: V-by-One link down timeout abnormality
Cause: Between the controller and the UK relay board (UKRYB), the training sequence starts after Link down and it cannot be linked again within a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • VIF board (VIFB) • UK relay board (UKRYB) • UK control board (UKCB) • Signal cable/1 (A9G1N101) • I/F cable/6 (AC5KN273)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.

Classification: IQ-501: White calibration block dirt / Wavelength shift (Colorimeter unit)
Cause: The operation result of the white calibration is deviated by 2 nm or more from the data at the factory default.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Colorimeter unit
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - Acquire the corresponding firmware from KNOVA. - ID: DLKM_BT1927308JP (Japanese), ID: DLKM_BT1927308EN (English) 3. Replace the colorimeter unit.
Solution: 1. Prior check • Check whether the colorimeter white calibration block is clean. • Check whether the colorimeter white calibration block is installed. • Check the connector and the wiring of VIF board (VIFB). • Check the wiring of the colorimeter unit. 2. Update the IQ-501 firmware (ISW target: Q2) to Ver. GM0-12.
Control during the detachment: Colorimeter unit unusable

Cause: The AD converted value is out of the specified value when the LED does not light.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Colorimeter unit
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Prior check • Check the connector and the wiring of VIF board (VIFB). • Check the wiring of the colorimeter unit. 2. Replace the colorimeter unit.
Control during the detachment: Colorimeter unit unusable

Control during the detachment: Colorimeter unit unusable

Cause: The deference of the reflectivity between each measurement before the equalization is more than the specified value.

Control during the detachment: Colorimeter unit unusable

Cause: During the white calibration, the light amount of the all wavelength becomes low due to the sticking of the paper dust.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Colorimeter unit • IQ drive board (PCB2)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body. Or press the help key, and isolate the faulty part.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel. - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel.

Prior check • Check whether the colorimeter unit or the colorimeter white calibration block is clean. • Check the connector and the wiring of VIF board (VIFB). • Check the wiring of the colorimeter unit. 2. Classification: Main body: Analysis area abnormality of image diagnostic chart
Cause: When the image diagnostic chart is analyzed, an abnormality of the printing area size is detected.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - Do not deactivate and activate the main power until you acquire the log data. - After you acquire the log data, deactivate and activate the main power, and check that the error is resolved.
Solution: 1. When the SC occurs, store the log in either of the following measures. • [Service Mode] - [Log Store] - [Execute Log Storing] - [Log+IQ Image Manual Store] • [Utility] - [System Information] - [Store Log & IQ Image] 2. Report to KM with the log data.

Classification: IQ-501: Gamma abnormality on the color density control
Cause: The generated gamma curve has an abnormality.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Note: - Do not deactivate and activate the main power until you acquire the log data. - After you acquire the log data, deactivate and activate the main power, and check that the error is resolved.
Solution: 1. When SC occurs, store the log with the ""Log Store"" in the service mode. (Refer to I.4.27 Log Store) 2. Report it to KM with the log data.

Classification: IQ-501: Correction result abnormality on the color density control
Cause: There is a large gap between the correction result and the target.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Note: - Do not deactivate and activate the main power until you acquire the log data. - After you acquire the log data, deactivate and activate the main power, and check that the error is resolved.
Solution: 1. If SC occurs, store the log in either of the following measures. • [Service] - [Log Store] - [Execute Log Storing] - [Log+IQ Image Manual Store] • [UTILITY] - [System Information] - [Store Log & IQ Image] 2. Report it to KM with the log data.

Cause: Software bug (such as an illegal memory access or a parameter error).
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. When the SC occurs, store the log in either of the following measures. • [Service Mode] - [Log Store] - [Execute Log Storing] - [Log+IQ Image Manual Store] • [Utility] - [System Information] - [Store Log & IQ Image] 2. Report it to KM with the log data. • Do not deactivate and activate the main power until you acquire the log data. • After you acquire the log data, deactivate and activate the main power, and check that the error is resolved.

Cause: The message queue is insufficient or destroyed.

Solution: 1. Prior check • Deactivate and activate the main power, and check that the error is resolved. 2. Reinstall the VI-514 (ISW target: Q3) firmware. 3. If the error is detected again, store the logs with [Log Store] on the service mode. 4. Report it to Konica Minolta with the log data.

Cause: When DF reads the original, an error occurs with the original conveyance control and the interval between the original conveyance becomes shorter than the prescribed value.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Scanner drive board (SCDB) • DF control board (DFCB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 3 and solution 6. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 6. 2. Check the connector connection between DFCB and SCDB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between SCDB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace DFCB. 5. Replace SCDB. 6. Replace IPB.

Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between CDB and the ADU conveyance clutch (CL8), CN166 of CDB, CN421 of CL8, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the connector connection between CDB and the ADU pre-registration clutch (CL9), CN174 of CDB, CN422 of CL9, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Replace CDB.

Classification: Main body: Conveyance drive board ICP blowout
Cause: When a specified period of time elapses after the power becomes active, an error detection signal of ICP13 is detected continuously for a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Conveyance drive board (CDB)
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection between CDB and the centering sensor (PS1), CN176 (CN6AD) of CDB, CN484 (Relay connector), CN423 of PS1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Replace CDB.

Cause: Communication error between the main body and DF.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • DF control board (DFCB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection of DFCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Replace DFCB.

Cause: Within a specified period of time after the DF lift-up motor (M5) rotates forward, the DF lift-up upper limit sensor (PS2) does not become active.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • DF lift-up upper limit sensor (PS2) • DF lift-up motor (M5) • DF control board (DFCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the original feed section, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection between PS2 or M5 and DFCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the drive or coupling of the gear of M5, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: DF: 5-C) 4. Check PS2, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: DF: 7-I) 5. Replace PS2. 6. Replace M5. 7. Replace DFCB.

Cause: Within a specified period of time after the DF lift-up motor (M5) rotates reversely, the DF lift-up lower limit sensor (PS3) does not become active.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • DF lift-up lower limit sensor (PS3) • DF lift-up motor (M5) • DF control board (DFCB)

Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the drive or coupling of the gear of M5, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: DF: 5-C) 4. Check PS3, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: DF: 10-C) 5. Replace PS3. 6. Replace M5. 7. Replace DFCB.

Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Document reading glass cleaning sensor (PS18) • Document reading glass cleaning motor (M8) • DF control board (DFCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the conveyance section, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Check the connector connection between PS18 or M8 and DFCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the drive or coupling of the gear of M8, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: DF: 6-C) 4. Check PS18, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: DF: 3-C) 5. Replace PS18. 6. Replace M8. 7. Replace DFCB.

Cause: When the DF cooling fan (FM) is rotating, the lock signal detects the activation continuously for a specified period of time. Alternatively, when the operation of FM stops, the lock signal detects the FM deactivation continuously for a specified period of time.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • DF cooling fan (FM) • DF control board (DFCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Rotate FM by hand, and repair it when there is any abnormality. (Wiring diagram: DF: 4-C) 2. Check the connector connection between FM and DFCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Replace FM. 4. Replace DFCB.

Cause: EEPROM cannot be accessed normally.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • DF control board (DFCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection and the wiring of DFCB, and repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Reinstall the DFCB firmware. 3. Replace PRCB.

Cause: When the main power becomes active, an abnormality is confirmed in the output from the multi feed detection board/TX (MFDB/TX) and the multi feed detection board/RX (MFDB/RX).
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Multi feed detection board/TX (MFDB/TX) • Multi feed detection board/RX (MFDB/RX) • DF control board (DFCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Check the connector connection between MFDB/TX or MFDB/RX and DFCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 2. Replace MFDB/TX, MFDB/RX and DFCB. 3. Replace DFCB.
Control during the detachment: The use of DF multi feed detection is unavailable.

Classification: Main body: Exposure lamp lighting abnormality or scanner connector disconnected
Cause: When the gain of the CCD sensor is adjusted, it is detected that the output of the CCD sensor is less than standard value. Alternatively, the scanner connector is disconnected.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Scanner drive board (SCDB) • CCD board (CCDB) • Exposure unit
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 2, solution 3, and solution 7. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 7. 2. Check the connector connection between SCDB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between CCDB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace the exposure unit. 5. Replace CCDB. 6. Replace SCDB. 7. Replace IPB.

Classification: Main body: Exposure lamp abnormal lighting
Cause: After the scanning job completes: When the scanner is at the standby position, it is detected that the average of the output value from the CCD sensor exceeds the standard value.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Scanner drive board (SCDB) • CCD board (CCDB) • Exposure unit
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 2, solution 3, and solution 7. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 7. 2. Check the connector connection between SCDB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between CCDB and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace the exposure unit. 5. Replace CCDB. 6. Replace SCDB. 7. Replace IPB.

Classification: Main body: Exposure lamp lighting abnormality or scanner connector disconnected
Cause: When paper is passed from DF: It is detected that the CIS output is the standard value or less in the CIS gain adjustment. Alternatively, the scanner connector is disconnected.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • CIS module (CIS) • Image processing board (IPB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Clean the CIS. 2. Clean the white reference side on the CIS side. 3. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 4 and solution 6. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 6. 4. Check the connector connection between CIS and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace CIS. 6. Replace IPB.

Classification: Main body: Exposure lamp abnormal lighting
Cause: When paper is passed from the DF: When the scan job is completed, it is detected that the average of the output value from the CIS sensor exceeds the standard value at the scanner standby position.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • CIS module (CIS) • Image processing board (IPB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Clean the CIS. 2. Clean the white reference side on the CIS side. 3. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 4 and solution 6. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 6. 4. Check the connector connection between CIS and IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Replace CIS. 6. Replace IPB.

Cause: When the CPU cooling fan (FM33) is active, an error detection signal is detected continuously for a specified period of time. Though the machine retries power feed several times, an error detection signal is detected continuously.

Classification: UK-301: During or after the HDD deletion
Cause: [Delete All Data Setting] of the HDD is being executed. Or, [Delete All Data Setting] of the HDD has been executed.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • SSD (SSD)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Report it to KM with the log data of the main body and the UK-301. 2. Replace SSD. 3. Execute the Format HDD All Data (UK-301). (Refer to I.4.29.3 Format HDD All Data (UK-301))

Cause: Files in the HDD are corrupted.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (99-03) of the hard disk bad sectors check and recovery (HDD/1, HDD/2, HDD/3, and HDD/4). 2. Execute the Format HDD All Data (UK-301). (Refer to I.4.29.3 Format HDD All Data (UK-301))

Cause: An error occurs with the HDD parameter.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • HDD/1 (HDD/1) • HDD/2 (HDD/2) • HDD/3 (HDD/3) • HDD/4 (HDD/4) • Interface cable/1 (AC5KN275) • Interface cable/2 (AC5KN276) • Interface cable/3 (AC5KN277) • Interface cable/4 (AC5KN278) • Power cable/H (AC5KN252) • UK control board (UKCB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Save the logs of the main body and the UK-301. 2. Check the connector connection between UKCB and the HDD/1, CN1702 of UKCB, CN702 of the HDD/1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Check the connector connection between UKCB and the HDD/2, CN1703 of UKCB, CN703 of the HDD/2, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between UKCB and the HDD/3, CN1704 of UKCB, CN704 of the HDD/3, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the connector connection between UKCB and the HDD/4, CN1705 of UKCB, CN705 of the HDD/4, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Check the connector connection between the power supply unit (PSU) and the HDD/1, CN551 of the HDD/1, CN5 of PSU, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 7. Check the connector connection between the power supply unit (PSU) and the HDD/2, CN552 of the HDD/2, CN5 of PSU, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 8. Check the connector connection between the power supply unit (PSU) and the HDD/3, CN553 of the HDD/3, CN5 of PSU, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 9. Check the connector connection between the power supply unit (PSU) and the HDD/4, CN554 of the HDD/4, CN5 of PSU, and the wiring. Then, repair it when there is any abnormality. 10. Execute the IO Check (99-92) of the file system initialization. 11. Execute the Format HDD All Data (UK-301). (Refer to I.4.29.3 Format HDD All Data (UK-301)) 12. Replace the HDD/1 (HDD/1), HDD/2 (HDD/2), HDD/3 (HDD/3), and HDD/4 (HDD/4). 13. Replace the wiring. 14. Replace UKCB.

Cause: The HDD/1, HDD/2, HDD/3, or HDD/4 is disconnected, or, one or more HDDs are damaged. In the other case, a HDD that KM does not specify is installed.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.

Check the connector connection between UKCB and the HDD/1, CN1702 of UKCB, CN702 of the HDD/1, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between UKCB and the HDD/2, CN1703 of UKCB, CN703 of the HDD/2, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the connector connection between UKCB and the HDD/3, CN1704 of UKCB, CN704 of the HDD/3, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Check the connector connection between UKCB and the HDD/4, CN1705 of UKCB, CN705 of the HDD/4, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 7. Check the connector connection between the power supply unit (PSU) and the HDD/1, CN551 of the HDD/1, CN5 of PSU, and the wiring. Then, repair it when there is any abnormality. 8. Check the connector connection between the power supply unit (PSU) and the HDD/2, CN552 of the HDD/2, CN5 of PSU, and the wiring. Then, repair it when there is any abnormality. 9. Check the connector connection between the power supply unit (PSU) and the HDD/3, CN553 of the HDD/3, CN5 of PSU, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 10. Check the connector connection between the power supply unit (PSU) and the HDD/4, CN554 of the HDD/4, CN5 of PSU, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 11. Execute the Format HDD All Data (UK-301). (Refer to I.4.29.3 Format HDD All Data (UK-301)) 12. Replace the HDD/1 (HDD/1), HDD/2 (HDD/2), HDD/3 (HDD/3), and HDD/4 (HDD/4). 13. Replace the wiring. 14. Replace UKCB.

Classification: Main body: Printer control initial communication abnormality
Cause: When the sub power switch (SW2) becomes active: Within a specified period of time, a response from the printer control board (PRCB) is not received.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Printer control board (PRCB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 2 and solution 3. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 3. 2. Check the connector connection between IPB and PRCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Replace IPB. 4. Replace PRCB.

Classification: Main body: Printer control communication abnormality
Cause: When the receiving from the printer control is completed, either error is detected; (1) data checksum error or (2) communication GA produces an error vector (parity, framing or brake detection). Alternatively, within a specified period of time after the sending is started, the sending does not complete.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Printer control board (PRCB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Perform the IO Check (99-70) and check if there is a problem with IPB. • When the results are abnormal, perform solution 2 and solution 3. • When the results are normal, perform following solutions other than solution 3. 2. Check the connector connection between IPB and PRCB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 3. Replace IPB. 4. Replace PRCB.

Note: - Contact the service manager of Konica Minolta about how to obtain or replace NRB. 3. Conduct the Format HDD All Data. (Refer to I.4.29.2 Format HDD All Data) (When you cannot conduct the Format HDD All Data, replace HDD/1 and HDD/2.)
Solution: 1. Report it to KM with the log data. 2. Replace NRB.
Control during the detachment: HDD unusable (HDD not connected) * Do not detach the faulty part when the scanner unit is connected.

Classification: Main body: Network control area abnormality
Cause: An abnormality occurs in the network control area of the SSD (SSD). (Network control error)
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • SSD (SSD) • Overall control board (OACB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Reinstall the firmware (P9) of the network control. 2. Replace OACB and SSD. (Refer to G.3.12.1 Overall control board (OACB), SSD (SSD))

Cause: The encryption library failed to be initialized before the NICFUM initialization. (Network control error)
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Overall control board (OACB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Reinstall the firmware (P9) of the network control. 2. Replace OACB.

Cause: An abnormality occurs in the network control area of the SSD (SSD).
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • SSD (SSD) • Overall control board (OACB)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Check the firmware (P9) of the network control, and reinstall the firmware when the version is different. 2. Execute the IO Check (99-03) of the auto correction for the broken files in SSD. 3. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of SSD. • When the results are OK: Go on to the step 6. • When the result is NG: There is an abnormality in SSD or the connection. Go on to the following steps, and check the SSD connection. 4. Check the connector connection between OACB and SSD, and CN302 of OACB. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the connector connection between the image processing board (IPB) and OACB, CN201 of IPB, CN1001 of OACB. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Conduct the Format SSD All Data. (Refer to I.4.29.2 Format HDD All Data) 7. Replace OACB and SSD. (Refer to G.3.12.1 Overall control board (OACB), SSD (SSD))

Cause: Files in the SSD are corrupted.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • SSD (SSD) • Overall control board (OACB)
Correction: Press the help key to deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (99-03) of the auto correction for the broken files in SSD. 2. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of SSD. • When the results are OK: Go on to the step 5. • When the results are NG: There is an abnormality in SSD or the connection. Go on to the following steps, and check SSD connection. 3. Check the connector connection between OACB and SSD, and CN302 of OACB. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between the image processing board (IPB) and OACB, CN201 of IPB, CN1001 of OACB. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Conduct the Format SSD All Data. (Refer to I.4.29.4 Format SSD All Data) 6. Replace OACB and SSD. (Refer to G.3.12.1 Overall control board (OACB), SSD (SSD))

Cause: An error occurs with the HDD parameter.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Hard disk/1 (HDD/1) • Hard disk/2 (HDD/2) • Interface cable (ACMHN271) • Interface cable (ACMHN272) • Interface cable (ACMHN274) • Power supply wiring (ACMHN273) • Image processing board (IPB) • HDD interface board (HDDIFB) • Overall control board (OACB)
Correction: Press the help key to activate and deactivate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - When you isolate the faulty part, the limited use is available. - The message ""Please call service"" and ""Press [Help] to disengage"" are displayed alternately on the touch panel. - When you press the help key, the message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Store the logs with Log Store on the service mode. 2. Execute the IO Check (99-92) of the file system initialization. 3. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of the HDD. • When the results are OK: Go on to the step 7. • When the result is NG: There is an abnormality in the HDD or the connection. Go on to the following steps, and check the HDD connection whose result is NG. 4. Check the connector connection between HDDIFB, HDD/1 and HDD/2, CN101 and CN102 of HDDIFB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the connector connection between the DC power supply/1 (DCPS1), DC power supply/2 (DCPS2), HDD/1 and HDD/2, CN5PU1 of DCPS1, CN4PU2 of DCPS2, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Check the connector connection between IPB and HDDIFB, CN2901 of IPB, CN100 of HDDIFB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 7. Conduct the Format HDD All Data. (Refer to I.4.29.2 Format HDD All Data) 8. Replace HDD/1 and HDD/2. 9. Replace the wiring. 10. Replace IPB. 11. Replace HDDIFB. 12. Replace OACB.
Control during the detachment: HDD unusable (HDD not connected) * Do not detach the faulty part when the scanner unit is connected.

Cause: The HDD/1 or HDD/2 is disconnected, or one or more HDDs are damaged. In the other case, a HDD that KM does not specify is installed.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Hard disk/1 (HDD/1) • Hard disk/2 (HDD/2) • Interface cable (ACMHN271) • Interface cable (ACMHN272) • Interface cable (ACMHN274) • Power supply wiring (ACMHN273) • Image processing board (IPB) • HDD interface board (HDDIFB) • Overall control board (OACB)

Solution: 1. Execute the IO Check (99-03) of the hard disk bad sectors check and recovery (HDD/1, HDD/2). 2. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of the HDD. • When the results are OK: Go on to the step 6. • When the result is NG: There is an abnormality in the HDD or the connection. Go on to the following steps, and check the HDD connection whose result is NG. 3. Check the connector connection between HDDIFB, HDD/1 and HDD/2, CN101 and CN102 of HDDIFB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Check the connector connection between the DC power supply/1 (DCPS1), DC power supply/2 (DCPS2), HDD/1 and HDD/2, CN5PU1 of DCPS1, CN4PU2 of DCPS2, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 5. Check the connector connection between IPB and HDDIFB, CN2901 of IPB, CN100 of HDDIFB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 6. Conduct the Format HDD All Data. (Refer to I.4.29.2 Format HDD All Data) 7. Replace the abnormal HDD. (Refer to L.1.1.1 Main body rear side 1) 8. Replace HDD/1 and HDD/2. (Refer to I.4.7.24 Storage troubleshooting procedure) 9. Replace the wiring. 10. Replace IPB. 11. Replace HDDIFB. 12. Replace OACB.

Replace OACB.

Classification: Main body: Paper interval processing error
Cause: When the image effective signal of the normal image output or the test pattern output is active, the effective signal of the belt, the patch and the registration becomes active.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Wiring (AC57N104) • Image processing board (IPB) • Printer control board (PRCB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please turn on power again"" is displayed on the touch panel.
Solution: 1. Prior check • Check that the CN5402 of the overall control board (OACB) is correctly connected. 2. Execute the IO Check (99-70) of the board self-diagnosis. Check the results of IPB/M. • When the results are OK: Go on to the following steps. • When the result is NG: There is an abnormality in IPB/M or the connection. Proceed to solution 5. 3. Check the connector connection between PRCB and IPB, CN107 of PRCB, CN54002 of IPB, and the wiring. Then repair it when there is any abnormality. 4. Replace the wiring. 5. Replace IPB. 6. Replace PRCB.

Cause: An erratic pagination is detected on the job during printing.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Overall control board (OACB)
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Replace IPB. 2. Replace OACB.

Classification: Main body: Browser abnormality detection (due to an internal factor)
Cause: The browser is detected to be unable to recover because of an abnormal shutdown of the browser process due to an internal factor.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Correction: Deactivate and activate the sub power switch (SW2) of the main body.
Note: - Do not deactivate and activate the main power until you acquire the log data. - After you acquire the log data, deactivate and activate the main power, and check that the error is resolved.
Solution: 1. Save the logs with Log Store on the service mode. 2. Report it to Konica Minolta with the log data.

Classification: Main body: Darker at trailing edge of paper rotation abnormally
Cause: The rot of the darker at the trailing edge of the paper is different from the rot during expansion.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB) • Overall control board (OACB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Replace IPB. 2. Replace OACB.

Cause: When an abnormality of the PS-CPU is detected, for example, the time cannot be acquired from the RTC.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Estimated abnormal parts: • Image processing board (IPB)
Note: - The message ""Please call service"" is displayed on the panel.
Solution: 1. Replace IPB.

Classification: Main body: Browser abnormality detection (due to an external factor)
Cause: The browser is detected to be unable to recover because of an abnormal shutdown of the browser process due to an external factor.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Note: - Do not deactivate and activate the main power until you acquire the log data. - After you acquire the log data, deactivate and activate the main power, and check that the error is resolved.
Solution: 1. Save the logs with Log Store on the service mode. 2. Report it to Konica Minolta with the log data.

Classification: Main body: Browser abnormality detection (Qt version mismatch)
Cause: The IROM version and the WROM version mismatch.
Measures to take when an alert occurs: when an alert occurs The main body and the option stop immediately.
Note: - Do not deactivate and activate the main power until you acquire the log data. - After you acquire the log data, deactivate and activate the main power, and check that the error is resolved.
Solution: 1. Prior check Check the IROM version and the WROM version, and upgrade to the latest combination. 2. After you upgrade the version, deactivate and activate the main power switch (SW1) of the main body. 3. If the latest combination does not improve the situation, report it to Konica Minolta with the log data.
